Description: Hollow terracotta figure of Harpokrates riding a stallion; he is dressed in a short tunic and wears a large bound wreath and a Double Crown; his finger is to his mouth. Flat-fronted plinth. Back un-modelled; circular vent. Two-piece mould. Brown Nile silt with some mica. Traces of a white dressing on front and edges.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Perhaps from Ekhmim (Akhmim/Panopolis). Ptolemaic, second century BC. Comparanda: Close and near, some probably from the same mould-series, others certainly not: Allen 1985: nos 47–9, from Karanis, dated first century BC/AD, and no. 50, dated late first to early second century AD (?); Ashmolean Museum, Oxford, no. 1970.1107; Bayer-Niemeier 1988: nos 145–56, all from Ptolemais Euergetis, of varying quality, and individually dated between the late first century and the third century AD; Besques 1992: no. E 359, from Middle Egypt, dated Roman period; Breccia 1934: nos 116–8; Brunner-Traut and Brunner 1981: pl. 160, dated late Ptolemaic; Christie’s 'Sale Catalogue', 13 July 1983: lot 320, the product of a very retouched mould; ibid., 11 June 1997: lot 131; Christie’s South Kensington 'Sale Catalogue', 14 October 1983: lot 40; Dunand 1979: no. 241, from the Fayum; Dunand 1990: nos 169–71 and 173, all from different archetypes and dated to the Roman period; Ede n.d.b: xvi, lot 21, dated first to second century AD; Fischer 1994: no. 625, dated second half of second century AD; Friedman 1989: 185, no. 95, dated c. AD 100; Kaufmann 1913: fig. 35:4, close but facing in the opposite direction; Laumonier 1921: no. 577; Maillard 1975: fig. 3, following p. 228, from Khara-Khoja, Sinkiang, China; Petrie Museum uc8761, from Memphis (?); Pingiatoglou 1993: no. 29, dated second century ad; Saad Rachwan 2003: 557, fig. 2a; Schmidt 1997: no. 127, dated second century AD; Schürmann 1989: no. 1085, dated first century AD; Török 1995: nos 86 and 89, which are thought to have late Hellenistic antecedents; Van Wijngaarden 1958: no. 32; Vogt 1924: pl. xiv:1; Weber 1914: nos 83 and 85, the last said to be from the Fayum. Bibliog: Budge 1925: pl. xxviii; Fischer 1994: 280, no. 625; Johns 2006: 22.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3069)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
